thread.title: Deathly still : Highlander Ben Smith knocked out after nasty head clash - Yahoo New Zealand
thread.title_full: Deathly still : Highlander Ben Smith knocked out after nasty head clash - Yahoo New Zealand

author: Heath Moore
title: Deathly still : Highlander Ben Smith knocked out after nasty head clash - Yahoo New Zealand
text:
'Deathly still': Highlander Ben Smith knocked out after nasty head clash Heath Moore - Yahoo New Zealand on February 25, 2017, 7:14 am Share Deathly still : Highlander Ben Smith knocked out after nasty head clash - Yahoo New Zealand The Highlanders are set to lose captain and star fullback Ben Smith for at least "a couple of weeks" after suffering a nasty head knock on Friday. Close 'Deathly still': Highlander Ben Smith knocked out after nasty head clash UP NEXT VIDEO 'Deathly still': Highlander Ben Smith knocked out after nasty head clash. Source: Sky Sport 'Deathly still': Highlander Ben Smith knocked out after nasty head clash 
Smith left the field with concussion inside the opening 30 minutes during his side's 24-15 loss to the Chiefs in Dunedin. 
The fullback contested a high ball with fellow All Black Damian McKenzie but landed awkwardly, slamming his head into the turf. 
McKenzie immediately waved to the referee to stop play, where Smith lay deathly still. Ben Smith and Damian McKenzie do battle in the air. Photo: Getty 
The game was halted for more than five minutes before being helped from the field. 
"Ben's probably going to take a couple of weeks, I'd say," Highlanders coach Tony Brown said after the match. 
He obviously got knocked out, so you don't come back from that in a week." Ben Smith lays injured after a head knock left him concussed. Photo: Getty 
The injury and loss is a major blow to the Highlanders, who were already without 10 players going into the season. 
"We've got a lot of injuries. I don't even know if we've got a fullback," Brown said. 
All Blacks number 8 Liam Squire also left the field with an injury for the Highlanders. Close Chiefs come out on top of Highlanders UP NEXT
